body:
The reason why I haven't documented the config file is that the majority of the remotes can't be configured that way as they use oauth2 which requires rclone interacting with a web server.

`rclone config` for swift has the rackspace endpoints built in which should make configuring rackspace swift really easy.

The config file for rackspace should look like this

```
[rackspace]
type = swift
user = USER
key = KEY
auth = https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0
```

issue.title: Rclone - Google Drive and own client_id

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I have tried following the instructions to make my own client_id (including doing the OAUTH). I have gone back to edit the clone config and selected my Google Drive config, added my settings etc however when I now run the command to seat clone I get an error message:

 ./rclone -v --config rclone.conf sync /data/Media/TV GDrive:/Media/TV
2017/03/07 20:15:15 rclone: Version "v1.34" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "-v" "--config" "rclone.conf" "sync" "/data/Media/TV" "GDrive:/Media/TV"]
2017/03/07 20:15:16 Failed to create file system for "GDrive:/Media/TV": couldn't read info about Drive: Get https://www.googleapis.com/drive/v2/about?alt=json: oauth2: cannot fetch token: 401 Unauthorized
Response: {
  "error" : "unauthorized_client"
}


Any suggestions please? This worked before I generated my own codes.
This is on a NetGear Ready NAS

body: I will try to review this in the next few weeks. Ed.

I had originally thought of going through creating example rclone.conf sections for a range of backends and pasting them into backend hep topics. That is just something else to maintain in step when in reality any rclone user wanting an example rclone.conf section will just create one with rclone config.  Backend specific flags and advanced ones are already documented directly from backend code.

I suggest this issue is closed.

@albertony 

Do you think we need rclone.conf examples in backend docs?

Hm... I agree with @edwardxml. But perhaps we could add a short description of the general syntax? I did not find that anywhere.. I mean something describing: Text file, where remote names are withing [], followed by "key = value" lines, where you at least must have key "type" with value according to the backend id as returned by `rclone help backends`, and optionally other options as described for each backend, etc...
Yes, sure, that is fine. So just describe how "sections" are "remote names" etc..

issue.title: docs: add short description of configuration file format

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

Add some documentation of the configuration file format, without going too much into details.

Seems rclone currently uses https://github.com/unknwon/goconfig library for handling the configuration file, but not mentioning this in the doc, as I guess it may change over time - and that one is actually documented as being sort of deprecated ("under bug fix only mode, which means no more features will be added").

I am linking to https://rclone.org/overview/ for list of backend "types", but it does not show the internal "codename" for the backends that must be put as value of the `type` key in config file. Command `rclone help backends` seems to show these type values. Perhaps the overview page should have listed them as well?

Added an example, used mega because I found that supported plain username/password auth, which makes it a simpler example than tokens etc..

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->

#572

#### Checklist

- [X] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [X] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [X] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
